questions_and_answers.question: Where is the UM Clinic located?
questions_and_answers.answer: The UM Clinic is located on the ground floor of the Siswarama building, Faculty of Arts and Social Science.

questions_and_answers.question: What are the objectives of the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: The objectives of the UM Clinic are: 1. Assessment of students' health status by conducting health screening and medical check-up 2. Deliver continuous high-quality medical treatment 3. Promote healthy lifestyle and wellness among the campus community 4. Provide medical support for university events 5. Engage students in community-oriented programs

questions_and_answers.question: What functions does the UM Clinic serve?
questions_and_answers.answer: The functions of the UM Clinic include providing health services to the UM campus community (staff and students), health promotion, medical support services, outbreak management, and collaboration activities.

questions_and_answers.question: What clinical staff are available at the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: The clinical staff at the UM Clinic include: 5 Medical Officers, 2 Assistant Medical Officers, 6 Staff Nurses, 1 Laboratory Technician, 2 Assistant Pharmacists, 3 Medical Attendants, and 2 Drivers.

questions_and_answers.question: What are the operation hours of the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: The operation hours of the UM Clinic are: Monday to Friday: 8.00 am - 10.00 pm, Saturday and Sunday: 8.00 am â€“ 1.00 pm, Closed during public holidays.

questions_and_answers.question: What services are provided by the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: The services provided by the UM Clinic include: Clinical consultation, Treatment for acute and chronic illness, Procedures (e.g., wound dressing), Vaccination, Ambulance service, Laboratory tests (blood, urine, swab tests), Pharmacy, ECG, Counseling, Medical check-up, Imaging & X-ray (UMMC), and Referral to specialist clinics & hospitals.

questions_and_answers.question: What is the procedure for obtaining treatment at the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: The procedure for obtaining treatment at the UM Clinic involves: Arriving at the UM Clinic, Undergoing triage/screening, Registration, Taking a QMS number, Consultation, and Receiving treatment/pharmacy services/referral if necessary.

questions_and_answers.question: What should you do in case of an emergency outside UM Clinic operation hours?
questions_and_answers.answer: In case of an emergency outside UM Clinic operation hours, you should go to UMMC for the following conditions: Accidents & injuries, High-grade fever, Difficulty in breathing, Excessive bleeding, Seizures, Severe abdominal pain, Unconsciousness. Do not go to UMMC if it is a non-emergency case.

questions_and_answers.question: What is a Guarantee Letter (GL) and when is it needed?
questions_and_answers.answer: A Guarantee Letter (GL) is issued by the medical officer of UM Clinic and is needed for hospital treatment or admission. The GL is valid for 3 months. In emergency cases, you do not need a GL but must submit the invoice to the UM Clinic.

questions_and_answers.question: What conditions are not covered by the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: Conditions not covered by the UM Clinic include: Ward admission to private hospitals or overseas, CT scan or MRI (CIGMIT), Wheelchair, crutches, or orthosis, Special medications (private pharmacy or pharmUMMC), Pregnancy, infertility, or contraception, Cosmetic or aesthetic surgery, Dialysis, Hearing aids, Dentures or braces, and Research-related treatment or investigation.

questions_and_answers.question: What is the medical examination procedure for new students at the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: The medical examination procedure for new students at the UM Clinic is compulsory. Students will be informed about their appointment date through their registered email (siswamail). The cost is borne by the student and the payment is made through UM e-pay (https://epay.um.edu.my).

questions_and_answers.question: What are the COVID-19 procedures at the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: COVID-19 procedures at the UM Clinic include: Self-testing and reporting symptoms using the Home Assessment Tool in MySejahtera, Filling up the Google Form (Link: https://forms.gle/h6HX5UGYhg4FibD28), Contacting the respective College Management/Faculty, and Following the quarantine procedure as per HSO guidelines. For health-related assistance, call 03 79676445 (Monday-Friday, 8 am-5 pm) or 03 79676448 (Monday-Friday, after 5 pm - 10 pm; Saturday & Sunday, 8 am-1 pm).

questions_and_answers.question: What is the contact information for the UM Clinic?
questions_and_answers.answer: For health-related assistance, you can contact the UM Clinic at 03 79676445 (Monday-Friday, 8 am-5 pm) or 03 79676448 (Monday-Friday, after 5 pm - 10 pm; Saturday & Sunday, 8 am-1 pm).
